posts.title: üìå Hexo Development Checklist
posts.text: .heimu { color: #000; background-color: #000; } .heimu:hover { color: #fff; } Here you can find my Hexo-Dev checklist and some useful hexo documentations Checklist & Index: DONE: Image Youtube video Favicon and logo (solved) Live 2d widget (solved 2021-04-14) (Almost) Everything needed TOC (table of contents) (solved 2021-04-15) Email subscription system (solved 2021-04-15) Share (solved 2021-04-15) Category (solved 2021-04-17) Create ‚ÄúAbout‚Äù page (solved 2021-04-17) Pin an article to top (solved 2021-04-17) Recommend instead of recent (solved 2021-04-17) Visitors of each post (solved 2021-04-17) code/mark (solved 2021-04-17) Visitor-traffics map Issue: can‚Äôt personalize it Change the Size of the Logo (solved 2021-04-18) Comments (no Ad) (solved 2021-04-18) Abbreviation Change (solved 2021-04-22) Costum logo (solved 2021-04-21) Syntax Highlighting Anchors in Markdown TODO: Encrypted Post Friends Badge at footer limit height of and Sitemap Auto switch normal/dark mode not in the fabulous guide Widget Graphviz Change the tags style in the post page Change the article-meta line Weather widget Fold a part of the tags Fold a part of the archives Code highlight ‚ÄúResources‚Äù list here (includes lots of useful documentations) which is basically a bunch of links (Under construction) Double live2d widget (?? worth it?) Complete ‚ÄúAbout‚Äù page ÊòæÁ§∫‰∏ÄË®Ä ‚Üë‚Üë‚Üë ËØïÁùÄÁÇπÂáª‚ÄúÊòæÁ§∫‰∏ÄË®Ä‚ÄùÔºÅ function showHitokoto (event) { event.target.classList.add('is-loading'); $.ajax({ type: 'GET', url: 'https://v1.hitokoto.cn/', success: function (data) { $('.hitokoto').text(data.hitokoto); event.target.classList.remove('is-loading'); } }); } Useful Documentations(Almost) Everything needed Fabulous guide about icarus Super Bulma demo Hexo ‰∏ªÈ¢òÈÖçÁΩÆ - Icarus Basically you don‚Äôt need anything else hehe. XD. No no no. I actually got help from other websites like GitHub and Stack Overflow General Blog of the dev of the icarus theme Markdown syntax Tag Plugin Hexo Markdown Guide GitLab HexoÂçöÂÆ¢ÁöÑMarkdownËØ≠Ê≥ï TOC Strange behaviour of TOC solution After deleted that plugin, the normal TOC showed up: Email subscription system A bilibili video RSS generator plugin download Google FeedBurner Wait wait, what does this mean? So there will be no email subscription via FeedBurner since this July? NOOOO! Comments (Disqus) Follow this recipe Disqus official site ShareFirst, I chose ShareThis because the dev of this theme icarus also uses this plugin. But then I realized that something is wrong with ShareThis. So I changed to AddThis, which works perfecly now. The complete guide Sharethis official site AddThis official site ShareThis unexpected behaviour: CategoriesI didn‚Äôt consult any documents, I figured it out by myself üòÜ. Just add this to the header of my .md file: .mdcategory: [cat1] Tags and Categories are pretty much the same thing. Insert the code below to header of the .md file to get sub-category called ‚Äúsubcat1‚Äù: .mdcategories: [Hexo-Dev, subcat1] ‚ÄúAbout‚Äù pageJust type this at terminal and excute: BASHhexo new page "About" Pin an article to top The complete guide After the installation make sure to type down ‚Äútop: True‚Äù in the header of the .md file. Abbreviation ChangeThe HB is a protein. .mdThe <abbr title="Hemoglobin">HB</abbr> is a protein. Abbr is not working. Artistic process: making a costume logoI have been using the rotated version of the ‚ÄúNexT‚Äù logo for a while If you rotate "N" by 90¬∫, you will get a "Z" XD.‚Ä¶it‚Äôs time to make my own logo! In night mode: In normal mode: Well, I have to say that I'm pretty satisfied with this logo üòÜ For now I will keep my browser tab favicon as it is. Repositioning the live 2D widgetChanged height to 180 and the cat now sit on the bottom of the browser window (much better). _config.ymllive2d: enable: true scriptFrom: local pluginRootPath: live2dw/ pluginJsPath: lib/ pluginModelPath: assets/ tagMode: false log: false model: use: live2d-widget-model-hijiki display: position: right width: 150 height: 180 mobile: show: true react: opacity: 0.8 I don‚Äôt like the code highlight style above. I will talk about that later in Syntax Highlighting Syntax HighlightingProblem I didn‚Äôt use this link, but I will put it here since it might be useful in the future PrismJS Well, I do get some sort of highlight, but not what I actually want. What I want is thisüëá style, but inside a real code block (so you can copy with one click and the code block gets its title): (...) display: position: right width: 150 - height: 300 + height: 180 (...) Hmmm I tried the ‚Äúthree inverse quote‚Äù method. Not good because I can‚Äôt change anything üò©: _config.yml(...) display: position: right width: 150<span style="color:#e88080">- height: 300</span> <--- WTF??<span style="color:#21db40">+ height: 180</span> <--- ????(...) Solution (Updated 2021-04-24)Haha finally I found how to do that: .config.yml- height: 300+ height: 180 This is where I found this method: Highlight deleted and added lines with GitHub Markdown This is how I achived that (use 4 inverse quote to write triple inverse quote!): .md```diff .config.yml- height: 300+ height: 180``` Anchors in Markdown Anchors in Markdown Very easy: [Anchor name](#title-with-no-spaces) Encrypted PostDownload the plugin named ‚Äúhexo-blog-encrypt‚Äù and follow the guide in this link Friends ‰∏∫ ICARUS ËÄåÁîüÁöÑÂèãÊÉÖÈìæÊé•È°µÈù¢ End of the page    Hexo logo

posts.title: I figured out how the mail system works
posts.text: The email only send one email at 16:00 (UTC+1) of each day.Well, nothing to worry about!

posts.title: Just a random new post to test email delivery system
posts.text: Let‚Äôs testAre you going to sent this new post to my subscriber, Google FeedBurner?? Please do it!

posts.title: This is a post without images
posts.text: Yes. This is a post without any kind of images, including thumbnail, cover, etc. The reason why of making this post is that the mailing system didn‚Äôt push the last post (the one with images of iOS mail app) to the subscribed email.I suspect that it is because of the images: FeedBurner‚Äôs useless server is not willing to store my images and push them to my mail.

posts.title: Email subscription system is working, but there's still something weird...
posts.text: After doing some Google FeedBurner stuff, I managed to subscribe my own blog with my own email. So this is the first ‚Äúblog update‚Äù email I have ever received: Well, what is the ‚Äúwerid thing‚Äù that I‚Äôve talked before?Look at this, google still thought that I have zero subscribers. Maybe it just refreshes at a slow manner. So nothing to worry about right now, since the system is working normally. Update 2021-04-16Seems like that my email is successfully subscribed to my blog üòä I‚Äôm happy.

posts.title: Successfully changed live 2d widget
posts.text: I successfully changed live 2d widget to a cat (well the ideal for me is some mecha-stylled widget wwww). The next step is to add two of them, one on the right side and another on the left. First thing to do is to install the 2d widget helper: BASHnpm install --save hexo-helper-live2d Next, install the model that I wanted: hijiki the cat: BASHusage: npm install {packagename}npm install live2d-widget-model-hijiki Then add the following code to the main ‚Äú_config.yml‚Äù file (not the ‚Äú_config.yml‚Äù of the theme): _config.ymllive2d: enable: true scriptFrom: local pluginRootPath: live2dw/ pluginJsPath: lib/ pluginModelPath: assets/ tagMode: false log: false model: use: live2d-widget-model-hijiki display: position: right width: 150 height: 300 mobile: show: true react: opacity: 1.0 Then everthing works normally.

posts.title: Maybe I found the reason of the incorrectness of the Safari tab favicon
posts.text: Soooo actually the safari tab favicon of newer pages is correct.<(ÔΩÄ^‚Ä≤)> Now I‚Äôm using Chrome. It is way better for web development! My explaination of the bad Safari favicon is: I don‚Äôt have that image in my local folders, hence the old favicon has to be stored in a Safari server. The favicon should be somehow ‚Äúassociated‚Äù to my blog‚Äôs link, so every time that some one opens my blog‚Äôs main page, Safari will put the icon stored in Safari‚Äôs server into user‚Äôs Safari tab icon. The old icon is not refreshed in the server end.When I create a new page, a new link is created. Then, the Safari‚Äôs server will store the correct favicon which is associated only to my new pages, but not the old ones.Solution: wait maybe one week or one month. Let‚Äôs see if the lazy Safari server refresh :/

posts.title: Doggo Vaccine
posts.text: Doggo got a vaccine ehehe.We went to a veterinary clinic at Arroios to get her a vaccine. The vaccination was a success. Everyone is happy.

posts.title: I give up
posts.text: Damn it. I have been working on this for say more than 4 hours, but the damn Safari favicon never changed at all. Where the fuck did the Safari get that old favicon? WHERE IS THAT GOD DAMN OLD IMAGE‚Äôs SOURCE FILE??? WHERE IS MY NEW IMAGE???The source code (index.html) says that everything is in its place. But the God Damn favicon didn‚Äôt refresh. Everyting is working on Chrome. The shortcut icon on Safari works perfectly. Why the stupid tab icon didn‚Äôt change? I already tried:1: Open my website at Private mode (Safari)2: Delete all Safari favicon cache that I found in this directory: ~/Library/Safari/Favicon Cache/ 3: Restart computerNothing above worked!But the Chrome has everything CORRECT! Damn it.No more hexo for today. I was really happy when I can put image on my site in the afternoon, but now I‚Äôm kinda pissed off.Oh btw, it was quite boring typing ‚Äúhexo clean‚Äù, ‚Äúhexo g‚Äù and ‚Äúhexo d‚Äù. Not to mention the time that you have to wait between these commands. I found that this is a ‚Äúcompact version‚Äù of deploy command, it‚Äôs quite handy: hexo clean && hexo g --d

posts.title: Solved site logo not appearing in a hilarious way
posts.text: Just RESIZE that God Damn safari window and my logo (fraud alert! XD) appeared!Now I finally solved the logo problem, one more to go:favicon displays differentely on Safari and Chrome wtf?

posts.title: First Post With Image (Fixed)
posts.text: My first try failed, but now (after n tries) it is working normally!Now the images doesn‚Äôt have a description‚Ä¶why? (‚Ä¢_‚Ä¢;

posts.title: test-img
posts.text: Image is working after excuting this command in terminal (pwd: zhx-hexo): npm install https://github.com/7ym0n/hexo-asset-image --save The code above was copied from: CSDN Video example:

posts.title: Solved no CSS style after generation (hexo g)
posts.text: Just add this code into _congif.yml and it will be solved: url: https://truezihaoxu.github.io/zhx-blog/

posts.title: Hello World
posts.text: Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub. Quick StartCreate a new post$ hexo new "My New Post" More info: Writing Run server$ hexo server More info: Server Generate static files$ hexo generate More info: Generating Deploy to remote sites$ hexo deploy More info: Deployment
